1.text: In the wild, every day is a busy day - especially for monkeys. What keeps them so busy? Monkey business Brice Reignier . Magriet Kruger . Wilna Combrinck English Free online books and tips for reading with young children at bookdash.org
1.summary: Monkeys are busy every day in the wild.

2.summary: A monkey leaps joyfully across the grassy field.

3.text: In the wild, there are many different animals: big and small, fast and slow. But every animal has a part to play.
3.summary: Wild animals of all sizes and speeds play together.

4.text: Elephants have long noses called trunks that sniff out water. They can find a drink even when it’s hard to see. And when they do, they trumpet to their friends: toot- toot!
4.summary: Elephants use their trunks to find water and trumpet to friends.

5.text: Rhinos like routine. They follow the same paths again and again, and make wide trails as they crash through the bush.
5.summary: Rhinos make wide trails by following the same paths.

6.text: Hippos love to eat sweet, green grass, and lots of it. Munch- munch- munch. They keep the grass next to the river short so the water is easier to reach.
6.summary: Hippos munch on sweet grass near the river.

7.text: But what about monkeys? Oh, monkeys have an especially important job.
7.summary: Monkeys have a special and important job in the jungle.

8.text: From sunrise to sunset, they’re on the go – climbing, tumbling and searching for food.
8.summary: Monkeys play and search for food from sunrise to sunset.

9.text: Monkeys dangle by their feet from trees, looking at the world ומופ-יסדן
9.summary: Monkeys hang from trees, watching the world upside down.

10.text: They swing from branch to branch in groups of two, three and four at a time. What fun!
10.summary: Monkeys joyfully swing in groups from tree branches.

11.text: Mama monkeys can do it all with a baby clinging to their belly. What do the little ones see from there? upon
11.summary: Little monkeys see the world from their mama's belly.

12.text: When they want a snack, monkeys pick a flea straight from a chommie's back.
12.summary: Monkeys get snacks by picking fleas from each other's backs.

13.text: And when they’re hot and tired, they cannonball into the water.
13.summary: Tired monkeys cannonball into the water to cool off.

14.text: What’s the important job that monkeys have? They play all day. And that’s hard work!
14.summary: Monkeys play all day, which is their important job.

15.summary: A monkey is running fast across the grassy field.

16.summary: A monkey jumps joyfully in the air.

17.text: Welcome to The Bookmark Reading Club! Did you enjoy the book? Would you like to play a game?
17.summary: Welcome to the club, enjoy the book, play a game.

18.text: Can you remember 5 facts about monkeys? Use the pictures below to help you! You can flick back through the book to help!
18.summary: Test your memory of 5 monkey facts from the book.

19.text: Which animal in the book is your favourite? Why are they your favourite?
19.summary: Asks which animal is favorite and why.

20.text: Did you enjoy reading together today?
20.summary: Ask if the reader enjoyed reading together today.
